messages: 6f9674da63103c2d4d9aae936ee67b58 (14:25): is there a way to display a horizontal line in a QMessageBox? (as in <hr />)

6f3f1ca2968b7ad487a291427fc6bf47 (14:29): how do i add a selectioncallback function in open inventor? i define a soselection node s, and do s->addSelectionCallback(selectionCallback, s); where selectionCallback is my function that shall be called
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:30): dick_: try it
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:31): dick_: maybe something like "<qt>Text<hr/>More text</qt>" works, i don't know
6f3f1ca2968b7ad487a291427fc6bf47 (14:31): the error is that it should look like &MyMainWindow::selectionCallback
6f3f1ca2968b7ad487a291427fc6bf47 (14:31): but that doesn't work neither
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:32): heh, open inventor. man, that was long ago
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:33): should the callback be a function?
6f3f1ca2968b7ad487a291427fc6bf47 (14:33): void selectionCallback(void *userData, SoPath *path)
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:33): then it has to be a function or a static method of a class
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:34): you can't (cleanly) make a method of some class a c callback
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:35): are you using Coin?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:35): ok
6f3f1ca2968b7ad487a291427fc6bf47 (14:37): i'm very new to c. how do i define a static function in the header? in the public or private block or do i define a static block?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:39): with qt you work with c++
6f3f1ca2968b7ad487a291427fc6bf47 (14:39): of course
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:39): let me give an example
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (14:41): 'chakie' pasted "Callback": http://qtnode.net/pastebin/737
6f3f1ca2968b7ad487a291427fc6bf47 (14:44): chakie_work: thanks a lot. works now :)
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:44): it does? nice
6f3f1ca2968b7ad487a291427fc6bf47 (14:44): yeah, i forgot to remove static in my mainclass
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:44): ah
6f3f1ca2968b7ad487a291427fc6bf47 (14:45): only in the header it has to be static
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:46): yup
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:47): in the .cpp it's basically just like any other method, but one that can't access members the same way
6f9674da63103c2d4d9aae936ee67b58 (14:47): how does the compiler determine sizeof(some_QString) ?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:47): it's not the size of the length, but the type
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:55): QString in this case
6f9674da63103c2d4d9aae936ee67b58 (14:57): er, yeah, so how does QString let the compiler know how much to allocate?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:58): the class/type has a fixed size
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:58): it doesn't take into account anything that QString might allocate later with new
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:59): it's the size of the class strucure along with members and some internal bookkeeping like virtual tables
ff0a1b32b57b24924f2d5141321cb965 (15:05): Over QSocket, QDataStream I write things like QTime and Q_UINT16 over TCP.  That's working.  But tcpdump -A shows something like E..<.h@.@.+R..........
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (15:07): paoleela_work: so, what should a uint16 look like then?

e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (15:08): i guess tcpdump tries to show the characters that the bytes represent, how would it know that the two bytes are actually an uint16 and that you want to see that particular value in some weird form?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (15:09): man tcpdump for more info
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (15:10): paoleela_work: can't you use ethereal ? It's much more easier to use
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (15:14): but why do it at all if it's already working?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (15:15): i guess anything that QDataStream serializes will be mostly useless to look at anyway, as it contains internal extra serialization data

551b55f20caaab142a332973a52820d3 (15:21): I currently use a QDialog as the main dialog for my application, but it does not get a taskbar entry. How can I fix that?
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (15:21): qmainwindow
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (15:21): JtRip: I guess you have to subclass the qlistview to redefine some mimesomething function
551b55f20caaab142a332973a52820d3 (15:22): Can I embed the dialog into the QMainWindow so I don't have to change all the layout stuff I've done so far?
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (15:22): ya, thats the problem, mimedata is empty :/
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (15:22): Phillemann: do you use designer ?
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (15:22): any ideas how to do that?

caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (15:23): i haven't found anything special :/
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (15:23): Phillemann: Hmmm then maybe just try to change your QDialog into a QMainWindow in your code
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (15:23): the problem is that QDropEvent->mimedata is a const :/
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (15:23): Phillemann: they're different widgets though, so you might have to modify some calls
551b55f20caaab142a332973a52820d3 (15:24): webustany: Ah, but they're both widgets. I thought QMainWindows was something different.
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (15:24): JtRip: Actually I'm going to have to do this in the coming hours/days
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (15:24): i have to do it now :/
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (15:24): JtRip: but I could do it now

551b55f20caaab142a332973a52820d3 (15:37): Has anybody tried compiling a Qt application which uses asio?
551b55f20caaab142a332973a52820d3 (15:37): I get a lot of compiler warnings.

551b55f20caaab142a332973a52820d3 (15:37): Or, can I exclude certain files from the standard compiler flags qmake sets?
551b55f20caaab142a332973a52820d3 (15:38): webustany: An "asynchronous network library", as the portage description states.
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (15:38): Phillemann: why do you need it ?
6397c0b52565fba78f90ef9d89638c4d (15:38): Phillemann: I mean, qtnetwork is async
551b55f20caaab142a332973a52820d3 (15:38): webustany: I want to separate the gui part from the network layer.
